item.description: One of my gripes with Bluesky is that I can't post a pointer to something I wrote there, because unless you have a Bluesky account, you won't get there. It's a publishing tool no? The root of the word publishing is 'public.' Please.
item.source:markdown: One of my gripes with Bluesky is that I can't post a pointer to something I wrote there, because unless you have a Bluesky account, you won't get there. It's a publishing tool no? The root of the word publishing is 'public.' Please.

item.description: It sounds like next week ChatGPT will be able to use information it finds on the web via plug-ins. This is a big expansion in capabilities.

item.description: Google Tailwind sounds like just what I've wanted, an AI that can read my writing and use it when answering my questions. I don't know if this is something I'd trust Google with though. They already have so much power.

item.description: There's only one public voice in the US, and that's journalism. And since journalism doesn't cover itself, we never look at their motives when discussing the news.
